review: Words can not describe how amazing this movie is, finally a spider-man movie that follows the cartoons perfectly, the effects were outstanding, i found myself on the edge of my seat many times in the cinema, i even cheered on spider-man when he was fighting the lizard (probably not a good idea in the cinema lol) this film was a whole lot better than then the previous spider-man movies, Andrew Garfield portrayed spider-man so much better than Tobey Maguire did (no offence to Tobey) all in all this movie is the amazing spider-man the title says it all go see it in 3d for the full effect, this and the avengers are defiantly films of the year, if you want something that follows the cartoon series of spider-man, this is the film for you

title: Loved it
review:
I have seen the film twice in order to create a good, honest review of the film. If you want to avoid the analysis, skip to the overall consensus.

I found myself praying, just before the movie started, that it would not be a let down. Spider-Man is my hero and has never failed to entertain me. yes, I even loved the third one. I was pleasantly surprised at how drastic Marc Webb had changed it. Peter Parker, who is played by the talented Andrew Garfield, does an amazing job as peter parker. This peter is darker, smarter and edgier than the Peter we had seen by Tobey. Also, Gwen Stacy, played by Emma Stone, was the perfect choice. The scene that really defines the film, in my opinion, is the rooftop. When peter shoots the web at Gwen and pulls her to him, her exasperated look combined with James Horner's brilliant score made me tear up slightly. It was beautiful. The action scenes, even though they were scarce, were tantalizing. They were crisply shot and edited. The best fight in the film took place at Parker's School. Watching the fight was like watching a comic book page come to life right in front of you.

Overall Consensus: The Amazing Spider-Man is, by far, one of the best reboots Hollywood has churned during a time when the word reboot was almost a curse word. The film is thoughtful, engaging, dark and mysterious but will definitely leave you wanting more.

title: The Amazing Spider-Man was a great movie.
review:
The Amazing Spider-Man was an amazing movie because of the actors and actresses, Andrew Garfield played a really great role as being Spider-Man and Emma Stone played a great role by being by Spider-Man's side and helping him when he needed it the most. They both really helped each other in the movie. And I think they are an excellent pair to work with. If you are someone who really likes and enjoys Spider-Man movies you know there is always a villain, The villain in the movie is fantastic, the visual effects that the directors and producers use to make the villain really make it seem real. In some movies I see the visual effects of a villain or a monster seem fake to me, but in The Amazing Spider-Man it definitely seems real.

I am only 14 years old and I really like Spider-Man movies.

title: A fantastic watch
review:
*WARNING: MAY CONTAIN SPOILERS* I'm going to level with you all. I probably would have given this 10/10 even if it was terrible, such is my love for Spiderman. Happily, this film is not terrible and so I feel like I can justify the rating.

Firstly, Andrew Garfield is superb as Peter Parker. Maybe a bit too good looking, but definitely brilliant. His performance is magnificent which allows us to see an emotional side of Parker that we haven't seen before. Add to this his brilliant sense of humour and this movie is on to a winner. Emma Stone is great as Gwen Stacy. I know we're not supposed to compare this reboot to the old trilogy but it's inevitably going to happen so let's get to it. Kirsten Dunst IS Mary-Jane. That's it. No-one will be able to do that part justice. Which is why I'm glad the filmmakers opted for Gwen as Peter's love interest. And Emma Stone plays her really nicely. Denis Leary is superb as Captain Stacy and Rhys Ifans captures the vulnerability and ambition of Dr Connors really well. The cast really impressed me.

The effects are really nicely seamed into the movie. You can tell that most of it is done with live action and the effects just add to the whole atmosphere of the film. I watched it in 3D and I have to say that (despite me not being a huge 3D fan) I liked it, mainly because it didn't seem forced.

This film is a real winner for me. We get to see why Peter decides to embrace his alter ego and how it affects him emotionally as well as physically. I really hope they make this reboot into a series of films because it has so much potential.

title: Loved it
review:
This movie was so good. I watched the original ones and really didn't like them. This movie used a cool actor to play a nerd while the previous ones used a nerd to play a nerd.

This movie had INTENSE action. The acting was terrific and the actors were terrific. You can tell right off that the guy who played spider man will be a star in many up coming movies.

The drama scenes were powerful and made me remember the times in my life when I experienced loss like they do, or love or whatever. Well done.

My wife is a chic-flic lover and she enjoyed this as well.

When the first spider man came out I was sooo stoked cause I read all the comics as a kid. I was let down. This version completely met my expectations.

Total summary: loved it.

title: outstanding
review: The movie was so amazing, except for one thing which is the events were so fast happening. All in all it was worth it and I advice you to go and watch it. if I want to compare it to the original spiderman movie, I'll chose this one. Simply because it's giving the store in a Specified way that make you understand better how all it happened. I was waiting for this movie about a year, let say I was expecting more than what i saw but, I didn't say It isn't a good movie. It's really excellent. i'm hoping the next part will be something spectacular like what happened with the dark night ! However i'm gonna give it 10 of 10 because I like spader guy ;)

title: the pointless spider-man
review: OK, if you are wondering why they made another spider-man movie, there is actually no concrete answer. The story is mostly same and there is no amazing fight scene or whatsoever that could make this movie or the spider-man character amazing. So if anything at all, you can call this movie as the pointless spider-man. I am sick of watching remakes of great movies. Just that you can shoot the movie in 3D (and the 3D of this movie was the worst I have ever seen) doesn't mean you should make another movie. I mean it, I don't want to pay to see the same things over and over anymore. Here is my grading for this movie. -1 for the originality, -1 for the acting, -2 for the super super bad 3D.

title: An outstanding film.
review: The amazing Spider-man is an outstanding, action filled film. I've only just watched it and want to see it again. It's suitable for the whole family to watch, and I truly hope that there's more Spider-man films to come, because everyone has been filled with action throughout, ever when there's not really any bad-guys there at the time. In this Spider-man a Scientist was trying to create an antigen that will repair all cells that are destroyed, and it will even grow back limbs in need be. But when he finds out that time's running out for him to make it or he's going to cut of money so that he will have to stop making it, he tries it on himself, but it's made out of cells from a lizard then it make the Scientist into a lizard man that Spider-man will later after get rid of. He gets rid of the crazy Scientist by using a mixture that will turn the lizards in the city that the Scientist made, back to humans, in which he succeeds in.

title: The AMAZING SPIDER MAN: Another great Spiderman? Or a New Spiderman?
review:
I was very excited about this coming title. Indeed, I am a big spider man fan and I was reading its comics when I was a kid. Therefore, I loved the first 3 chapters. They made me feel like a kid again. I loved very much how spider man was presented, i.e just like in the comic book: Very shy, sensitive,humble, a bit confused, a sort of looser and very much oppressed by his boss. He also had very complex relationship with Mary Jane. There was also a strong and mixed friendship with Harry...So a very lovable and king person, with gentle character, high morals and excellent attitude. A model for kids, and even adults :) All of that is what made me love spider man, above the super hero and super powers. And I believe it is the reason for its success above super hero fans public. He felt like a real guy, with real problems, and a real life. Someone everyone feels attached and emotional about. His love story made many frustrated when he couldn't face his lover, and finally relieved when he did. So I am a real spider man lover, and I should have loved this new movie as much as I did with the others.

So with this "new" spider man, I was wondering what would be new about it? I expected amazing 3D, and being transported another time in the complexity of Peter Parker's life. But what a shock! Peter Parker was turned into a confident high school teenager,and quite good looking I must confess (Better than the previous one I suppose). He has no job, no friends except his future girl friend. Also, the story seemed to have somehow changed, and this teenager is trying to find out more about his parents. Basically,this new movie has kept the "spider man" basics to make up a new whole spider man, lacking of character, humor, depth. There was not a moment where I heard anyone laughing at the cinema, whereas the original spider man always attracted a lot of laughter, especially with his boss. In fact, I felt it was a NEW spider man for a new generation of kids, aged 7-14 to make it look closer to their life interests and to help sell more merchandise. Indeed, the new spider man is in high school (almost an adult for the age categories mentioned above) and displays more his gadgets than the previous one. These are clearly identified in this movie, so the kids can get them in the shops. This new hero is good looking with a winner look and attitude, he is what we can call " cool", exactly the opposite of the genuine spider man. He shows off when he is angry, beats his friends at school, mocks the police, and displays a lot of arrogance. To me, it is nothing like the spider man I know.

To come back to this new movie, the transformation into spider man has been shortened to few min in the subway, probably a cut in the editing to make the movie shorter. His uncle was also killed very quickly and his deep love to his aunt was barely showed, or at least not enough. His love for Mary Jane looked more like an attraction and admiration for someone out of his league. It was almost the case in the original spider man, but she was his neighbor and they grew up together. So there was a real connection and emotion between them, mixed with their trio friendship.

The only positive point of this movie is it is obviously taking advantage of the new computers capabilities, rendering a much better appearance and action scenes. But still, the 3D was the slightly enhanced 3D most new movies offer, nothing like the magnificent 3D superman was given. Indeed, Spider man is one of these movies where you could demonstrate new and maximum 3D capabilities. I was expecting break through in 3D, but instead the action scenes were kept to the minimum, probably covering 10% of the movie length.

To resume, the new amazing spider man is a set up for a new hero, with similar background than the original spider man. But it represents to me a transformation of the story making the character superficial, impulsive, lacking of emotions, which could match better kids and teenager-to-come ideals and taste. I don't believe any grown up or genuine spider man fan would fall under the spell of this new spider man. Just too simple and not deep enough. Now, many younger viewers who don't know spider man or who haven't read the comics may still find it is an "Ok"or even a good movie. And this is what the producers are tabling on: creating a new hero to suit better a new generation needs. Is it though really necessary? As the fundamentals and moral principles are still unchanged, and I believe there was no need to spoil a great story and a super hero with character into a good looking orphan teenager with super powers and the respect of his entire school.

All other super hero movies kept the original spirit, including the latest avengers where nothing needed to be changed to make of it a block buster. I heard they are already preparing a second opus...maybe they should make it a "lego" one...At last, people would know who it is really meant for.

title: Really great movie!
review: I absolutely loved this movie! Every actor and actress in this movie did a really great job. Andrew Garfield makes a great Spider Man and Emma Stone does a great job as Gwen Stacy. Rhys Ifans was good as the Lizard and as Dr. Connors. Sally Field, Denis Leary, and Martin Sheen all played very well in their roles. The Amazing Spider Man makes the first three look even worse than I thought they were before. I loved almost everything about this movie. There's only one thing that I didn't love about it. They made the origin story very long. It was a pretty long movie because of this, but everything was very enjoyable. Everything in the movie contributed to the overall story. I think anyone would love this movie. I love comic books and comic movies and most action movies. I took my girlfriend who only likes comedy and horror movies and she enjoyed most of this movie which I wasn't expecting. So if you want to go see a really fun, exciting movie with a good story and good action, go see The Amazing Spider Man. It's definitely worth it!

title: Incredible in all genres. Great action, romance, drama, and effects.
review: the original Spiderman series really set the bar for superhero movies. Some people say the dark knight raised it. The Amazing Spiderman rips the bar off and ate it for breakfast. The movie is unbelievably fantastic from start to finish. The setups are not distracting, but not overlooked either. They tie in to later events, and really pull you into the story. There is never a dull moment, with action, suspense, romance, or breathtaking visual images in every scene. I went to the theater expecting a decent flick, one that might think of rivaling the original, as a nice set-up to the dark night rises in a few weeks. My mind was completely blown, and now I'm wondering if batman better watch his back. The Dark Knight really changed the way people looked at superheros, and The Avengers further cemented that belief, but The Amazing Spiderman proves that it can definitely contest those two. The Dark Knight Rises better watch its back, because The Amazing Spiderman takes viewers for an exciting ride, and believe it or not, really has a chance of being the blockbuster of the summer.

title: Emotional Depth and Brilliant Entertainment
review: I saw this today for the first time and I absolutely loved this film. I grew up with the comics and hand on heart, I can honestly say that this is a truly great film (for both geeks and regular cinema goers!) and one that is far more faithful to the Spidey universe than Raimi's version ever was. Sure, Raimi's was more accurate with the origin story, but when it comes to characters, this one has it spot on and is the comic come to life. Webb's new version manages to be both exciting and truly affecting. It has an emotional depth unlike a lot of similar genre films and is really quite an adult take on Spider-Man. It wisely takes the time to establish the characters and by the time the action starts, you're truly invested and care about the story and Peter. I'll be honest with you, the villain could have been better (although Rhys is great as Connors) and like Raimi's goblin design, could have done with a little bit more thought, and yes a giant lizard running around New York does jar with the new 'realism' aspect Webb has introduced, but these are minor quibbles when the overall package really is fantastic. Anyone going to see this just to see CGI fights (yes Michael Bay fans, I'm talking to you!) will likely be disappointed. But if you favour character and acting over spectacle (although it does have some fantastic effects and set pieces) this is for you. To give you and an example of the type of film this is, both the Guardian and Radio 4 gave this 4 out of 5 stars. Thats unheard of for a film like this!! I can't wait for the sequel. Bring it on!

title: Was that it ?...
review:
Upon entering the cinema i was hoping for an experience much like the Avengers. I was optimistic and enthusiastic, yearning for a thrilling movie experience.But unfortunately, i was immensely disappointed. The movie was nothing out of the ordinary really, no scenes exhibited that enthralling factor which movies like The Dark knight are known for. The Amazing Spiderman represents a movie that promised so much yet delivered so very little. Since i haven't read any of the comics, its hard for me to understand what the comic readers are going on about.They say that The Amazing Spiderman stays true to the comic and that it is how the earlier Spiderman movies should have been portrayed from the commencement. The performance by Andrew Garfield was commendable, what with the myriad intensely emotional scenes scattered across the film. His acting was accurate,believable and deserved of ample praise.

The movie dragged on for large periods, making me feel restless and impatient. By the end it felt so thoroughly anticlimactic and mundane that i couldn't help but fiddle about with my cell phone.

The Amazing Spiderman, although having some real impressive moments in between, does not deserve a spot amongst the truly great superhero films.The film acts like a reality check for those eagerly awaiting the release of The Dark Knight Rises ; we don't always get what we expect.

title: Best Spiderman Movie ever!
review:
This movie has saved the Spiderman Franchise, Garfield is SOOOOOOO much better that Mcguire. The best thing about this movie, no Dunst. Others that say this movie is no good are just writing what I call hate reviews, mostly by people who have not even watched it yet. I just watched it about 4hrs ago

This movie is by far the best Spider-man movie ever! I don't like to dis Raimi but he has been outdone this time. My kids liked it and so did my wife, and she doesn't even watch these kind of movies, also I am not a huge spider-man fan, I like the comics, but hated the 3 movies, this one has renewed my interest in spidey movies.

title: I did not think it was possible
review: I really did not think that this reboot of Spiderman would be better then 2002's by Sam Rami. I was very pleasantly surprised. The weakest part of the 2002 movie was the cast, and especially Kristen Dunst. This was a great movie. The cast was spot on. The chemistry between Emma Stone and Andrew Garfield was terrific. The story was great and had a good balance for a superhero movie of action and dialog. There are a few weak points but after all it is a comic book. This was not related in any way to the origin story told in 2002, but for fans of Spiderman this version stays true to the essence that we know and love. Marvel has been on fire recently. They are doing a great job translating their stories to the big screen and this was no exception. I look forward to the next chapter.

title: Spiderman at its best!
review: This was spider man at its bests! I sat through the whole movie wanting it to continue! This was way better then the other movies! Great choice for the characters and they couldn't if cast it better! Can't wait for the next movie!!! Defiantly going back again! Their was literally no bad parts! But if you go to the movie make sure you stay for the credits they show a Scence clueing into the next movie!! Their is great graphics in this movie as well! The storyline was great throughout the movie and clear! You would think that the movie was going to be bad because the changed story , but, it was not that different!!!!!! Once again this was a great movie , great character and a great and clear storyline! This is a great movie for all ages and I can't wait for the next movie!

title: My biggest disappointment at the movies this summer
review:
Now I ain't a big fan of Sam Raimi's version of "Spider-Man" it just wasn't that consistent with the comic books or even stayed all that close to the comic books all that much. This one decides to go in a more cool and realistic direction but that seemed to be the main focus of it all without much emphasis on making a entertaining movie with a better script. I liked how makers of this movie tried to modernize everything in today's standard, thus not making the movie all cheesy and stuff like Sam Raimi's version. Like for instance Peter Parker(Andrew Garfield) is a nerd like how Peter Parker is suppose to be but he isn't portrayed as one of those stereotypical nerds. Instead he is one of those quite nerds that is very quite lack confidence in many areas and always sits in the back to the point of almost never getting noticed. What was the most disappointing is how lacking it is, in character development and the bonding elements in this movie. Marc Webb's only full feature movie besides this one is "500 Days of Summer" which was a well made romance/relationship movie. But the chemistry between Peter Parker and Gwen Stacy(Emma Stone) isn't well developed. Sometimes it's just not close to being believable at all. In fact it's really inconsistent yeah it's playful but inconsistent. I kept wondering what really linked these two characters together. Even Peter Parker's bond between Uncle Ben(Martin Sheen) is just weak and not enough bonding time went into it. When the main reason why Peter Parker became Spider-Man is because of Uncle Ben. Even Peter Parker isn't all that likable in this movie, so he is going through some traumatic time in his life. But people around the world is going through so much worse. Now Spider-Man is known for being a superhero that taunts and humiliates his foes and I was expecting him to do that quite a bit in this. And wanted to laugh or at least be amused by his one liners but there isn't much of that here. Maybe it's because he is just getting use to his powers in this one, but was still sort of disappointing. When they marketed this movie to the public it tries to go in some untold secret, but there really isn't anything like that in this. Nothing that will throw the audience off in a good way or anything like that. Now I didn't like Sam Raimi's version of "Spider-Man" all that much, it's was just so darn cheesy sometimes and doesn't connect with the comics all that much but it was still enjoyable and entertaining. Now some reviewers claim this reboot is better than all the Sam Raimi's "Spider-Man" combined and that is a overstatement in my opinion. This is a darker cooler and more modernized version of "Spider-Man" but it sure does have it's flaws. Now when it comes to the Spider-Man fight sequences it's really realistic, especially with the movement of Spider-Man and all. It really felt like your watching a webslinger in action sort of. The physics and movements seemed like your actually watching a guy in a suit moving although it's CGI. The fight scene with Spider-Man and The Lizard was cool and sort of reminded me of the fight in "Ultimate Spider-Man" although that was against the Green Goblin. The casting choices is good Andrew Garfield and Emma Stone is alright although there are other actors and actresses that might have done a better job that I can think of. But Rhys Ifans was perfect for the role Dr. Curt Connors and Denis Leary was right on target with the role of Captain Stacy. Overall this isn't a terrible Spider-Man movie, much better than "Spider-Man 3" for sure. It almost seemed like they tried to be different just for the sake of being different between the past "Spider-Man" movies. Which is understandable, but it just seemed they were really forcing it. I really wanted to enjoy this movie, in fact Spider-Man is one of my favorite superhero but this was kinda disappointing. "Spider-Man 2" is still the best Spider-Man movie so far.

6.8/10

title: an improvement, but still not good enough
review: first spider man movie. OK second spider man movie. good third spider man movie. bad fourth spider man movie, the reboot the amazing spider man was better then the third, better then the first, but still nothing to get all excited about. to be fair this movie had a lot of hype and the pressure certainly hit a lot of the cast and crew. especially Andrew Garfield. he is really the only person who plays a main character from the other films. the lead role. and if he doesn't do good, the movie fails because it centers around spider man. but Andrew Garfield topped Tobey Maguire performance by a long shot. Tobey Maguire to me in some ways was like the Adam west to spider man. very kid friendly, and hes not intimidating. Andrew Garfield it much darker and can be taken more seriously, mainly because he is surrounded by a darker area and has a better script. i like how they put Gwen Stacy as the love interest because she was the first love interest and i wont say what, but her story ends very dark, which will lead to a even darker sequel with a much more darker villain. the villain curt Connors I've been waiting for in the raimi series. they gave Connors a lot of development but never went anywhere. this one i think they put him in there with you supposed to know who he is from the raimi films. but the actor that played him very well. veteran actors martin sheen and sally field do great in there roles as uncle Ben and aunt may and bring some maturity to the cast. and Stan lee of course makes an appearance. now this movie said it would be closer to the comics. in some respects they were but there was a lot missing and no doubt this spider man could not keep his identity secret. the story is strong but it seems rushed towards the end. they refer to Norman Osbourne a lot in this film, but technically doesn't make one appearance and the reason i said technically is because the clip after the credits were Connors is talking to someone may or may not be Norman. but this movie couldn't live up to the hype and it was a lot of hype and i guess people that like the film can use too much hype as an excuse but if the dark knight rises is good, that has massive hype and if it lives up to the hype that excuse goes out the window. again a movie worth checking out, but not to rush to see. i say see it, but no hurry. see it

title: "A Marvelous Spider-Man"
review:
Marc Webb's "The Amazing Spider-Man" is a well rounded film that captures everything you'd expect from a Marvel story line and a Spider- Man film as well. It had everything you want from a Marvel film including: romance, comedy, action, and fun. Some reviewers have criticized this films over-use of the romance element, but I personally enjoyed this aspect.We must not forget that Spider-Man is in high school and romance is undoubtedly a pivotal part in the mask vigilante's comic book presence as well. Most importantly this movie is FUN and I never found myself bored at any point. In fact some of the scenes are so visually phenomenal that you are left in shear amazement. For a two-hour long film, it feels slightly rushed but that's what adds to the constant excitement.

The actors were phenomenal in almost every area. Andrew Garfield completely embodies the Peter Parker/Spider-Man persona perfectly. I can't say that I was shocked because he really took this role as an honor and was very dedicated to embracing the character. Emma Stone is equally as great in her role as Gwen Stacy and you will not be disappointed. Generally I'm not huge on Emma Stone, but I absolutely adored and bought into her character throughout the duration of this film. The only character I was slightly turned off of was Sally Field as Aunt May. She wasn't necessarily bad, there was just something about Sally Field's portrayal of Aunt May that was slightly unsatisfying. Rhys Ifans as Dr. Curt Connors/The Lizard was an excellent selection and you'll find that he is a viable good guy and bad guy simultaneously. His story line isn't really explored enough for my taste, but that's a matter of my personal opinion.

Ultimately, I noticed that if you go into this film trying to compare it to the 2002 series you're going to be overly critical of "The Amazing Spider-Man." That being said, in comparison to the old series I felt this one was far more visually pleasing and the overall tone of the film was much more gripping. Andrew Garfield exceeds Tobey Maguire as the masked superhero and he portrays the character better in almost every way. This movie may seem rushed or overly fast-paced for some because Marc Webb didn't want to over-state plot-points that had already been used in the previous trilogy.

Don't allow others to manipulate your view of the movie before you enter the film. If you go in with an open mind and are prepared to have a good time, I guarantee you will not be disappointed!

title: Heartwarming, beautiful with fantastic performances. This is Spider-Man!
review:
I will keep it short, because that is what you guys want. Short, spoiler-free impressions are the best.

So firstly, Andrew Garfield was terrific as Spider-Man/Peter Parker. From this day, he IS Peter Parker. What an amazing performance. Two thumbs up!

Secondly, Emma Stone was great. She embodied Gwen Stacy in a way I never could have imagined. She and Garfield had a perfect chemistry on screen.

Finally, the movie itself was beautiful and tear jerking. I almost cried a couple of times. Sure, it probably can be picked apart my people wanting to find plot holes, but the feeling the movie leaves you with is warm and heartwarming.

Marc Webb and Co.; you did a great job! Two thumbs up!

I give it a solid 8.8/10.

title: The Best of the Series
review: This is some of the rare moments that new movie is shown a step ahead of the US. Benefit from the young crew, this reboot is refreshing and much more energetic / light-hearted. On visual effects side, this is perhaps the best 3D among all recent titles -- the scenes are not dimmed with 3D effects. The swinging scenes are sharp and not too fast (that you can catch up and appreciate). One tip - as usual - don't sit too close to the screen. That said, the view time is a bit too long, I don't mind to cut it short by 5 to 10 minutes. Honestly, some of the scenes are a bit slow and can be removed. In short, this is a movie you need to view in theater because many of the frames are packed with color and details, and definitely, the swings are a lot more powerful in big screen.

title: The Amazing Spider-Man (3D) (U/A)---------------Rating: 4/5
review:
The Amazing Spider-Man (3D) (U/A)---------------Rating: 4/5

It is an action superhero flick...... Amazing 3D effects especially in the climax...... Stunts and BGM was amazing...... New Direction and cast of this spider man was amazing.....

Catch the spiderman in 3D to enjoy more.......

Peter Parker finds a clue that might help him understand why his parents disappeared when he was young. His path puts him on a collision course with Dr. Curt Connors, his father's former partner.

While walking down the aisles after the end credits started rolling for 'The Amazing Spider-Man', I overheard a couple discussing about the film. While the boy argued that there wasn't anything new in the film and was 'just' about Spidey jumping all over the city, the girl -who seemed to have been reasonably entertained - shot back stating -'What else did you expect?'.

Well, this argument pretty much seals the word of mouth that the film is all set to get. For those expecting Spiderman in all the swinging action, they would indeed have some good time for those two hours. However for those expecting something indeed new, then well, 'The Amazing Spider-Man' isn't quite the film for them.

title: Exciting
review: Yes its amazing. Introducing Spidy again was difficult when we have already seen him in action over the past few years. Marc Webb has done a superb job in setting the storyline. Andrew Garfield did a good job in new avatar. Emma Stone looked cute playing Gwen Stacy. Dr. Curt Connors was really a bad-ass villain. The movie had a humour which was great . Good action sequences, not at all boring. The Movie is a must watch for all the Spiderman fans. One thing which i am still thinking is for whom was Rajit Ratha(Irrfan Khan)working. Now we have spidy back in new style lets wait for his next encounter with is new enemy. Who will it be, The Chameleon or The Vulture or The Jackal or Mysterio or Electro or J. Jonah Jameson.

title: Old wine in a brand new 3D bottle!
review:
"With great power comes great responsibility". These were the words of advice for young Peter Parker by his Uncle Ben. After looking at the Marc Webb's latest flick, The Amazing Spiderman 3D, we understand that he too have the same advice in mind. The expectations that were already set by Toby Maguire as Spiderman and Sam Raimi as the director of the previous Spiderman trilogy had to be reached, if not exceeded. Let us not even compare. Let's try to find out whether the duo of Andrew Garfield as the new Spiderman and Mark Webb excel in terms of the hype that was created for promotion of the movie.

It is for sure that Marc Webb had to recreate the magic that was created a few years back by Sam Raimi. Only time will tell whether he has been successful in his venture or not. However it can be said that this time the viewers are in for more. This time the story does not start from where Peter was bitten by a genetically engineered spider. We get to see Peter's parents as well and are made aware of the reason why Peter and his parents are not together.

Besides this, we also see crime rising in the city of New York. Emma Stone as Gwen Stacy (Peter's first Girlfriend) is quite a handful. Andrew and Emma together have taken the emotional degree of the movie to new heights. And Gwen is not naïve and soft hearted girl as Mary-Jane Watson. She doesn't think twice to land a punch or two towards the bad guys.

Next comes Dr. Curt (Jekyll) Connors, a character played by Rhys Ifans. He shares an equal screen presence with the Spiderman and his alter-ego Peter Parker.

Andrew Garfield fits perfectly in the Spidey-suit and also brings out the helplessness of his alter-ego Peter Parker. This time though, Peter Parker has a comic touch to his character.

Whether you will call Irrfan Khan's role in the movie as meaty or a promotional stunt is up to you.

One thing that can be assured is that this movie is a visual treat. Let's see whether The Amazing Spiderman 3D is able to bring a new outlook to the superhero genre.

title: I don't blame the actors
review:
====May Contain 'General' Spoilers===== I don't blame the actors for this letdown. It was really the script. The storyline was all over the place. There was no explanation about why his parents were important. His origin, their origin, nada. He just cried a few times when they were mentioned. The only thing you come away knowing is his father was a scientist that worked at Oscorp and abandoned him. Based on the commercials, there seemed like there was going to be a completely new door opened on how peter parker came to be (I think in one commercial the villain was asking rhetorically "you thought this was an accident??". I don't even recall that line being stated in the movie at all.)

So there was no 'Untold Story', which I thought was the point of this movie. It was just a remix of the same story with a different villain. And the special effects were NOTHING to write home about.

Basically if you saw the previous Spiderman, you already saw this one.

title: Anyone who writes this movie was any good is a paid plant
review:
I went into this movie with High Hopes, and I left 30, to 40 minutes early. The Story Origin Story Dragged on for to long, so long in fact I found myself nodding off. The Spidey Franchise was Re-Booted from 10 years ago, not 40. That means dang near everyone in the audience has probably seen the other iterations. So Dragging out in part of the Love story, or awakening story was a mistake.

Actors: Overall the Acting was good, but there were some extremely Corny lines, that their good acting covered up.

Visuals: Spidey Looked great, the sets looked great, but the Lizards, and the Lizard looked terrible.

Story: Love story was forced, Plot was Juvenile, the talking while spider man was fighting was terrible.

Action: How could you ruin the action of a Genetically created 8 Foot Lizard, fighting a Genetically created teen endowed with the strength of a spider....I don't know but they did.

In Closing I thought this was going to be a great movie for the summer after classics this year such as Prometheus, and the Avengers. It did not live up to those standards. once the word of mouth is out about how bad this movie is it will not break 100 million domestically.

title: A New Spin on a (Not So) Old Friend...
review:
I recently attended a preview screening for The Amazing Spider-Man, and it was, without a doubt, an excellent (re-)interpretation of Spider-man's origins. Yet, after the film, I overheard a number of people comparing it to Sam Raimi's "original" trilogy. It's as if by saying that they enjoy this film, people feel they are somehow "betraying" the memory of Raimi's trilogy, which is, of course, nonsense.I love Raimi's efforts, and include Spider-man 2 as one of my favorite (not just superhero) films, but to compare them, particularly in either positive or negative terms, would be, to my mind at least, completely pointless. The Amazing Spider-man stands firmly on its own, yet it could just as easily be placed right alongside Raimi's films, as it in many ways, complements them. I have also read, with interest, a couple of reviews citing thematic similarities between The Amazing Spider-man and the Twilight saga, which is just plain ridiculous. After all, I don't recall seeing Gwen pull a Bella and lock herself in her bedroom for six months (or was it a year? I forget) after her last conversation with Peter, do you? As for those that have "reviewed" the film without even seeing it, well, the less said the better.

Andrew Garfield's portrayal of Peter Parker/Spider-man was just brilliant, his is a character you can empathize with and cheer for, and it was refreshing to see him display some heroic qualities even before he is given his powers by the not-so incy wincy spider. Emma Stone showed great humanity as Gwen Stacy. Sassy, funny and fiercely intelligent, she was an inspired choice to play Spidey's first love. Rhys Ifans was suitably conflicted as Spidey's nemesis. I was also thankful that Dr Connors went through an organic, therefore literal, transformation into the creature, it makes me look forward to seeing how the filmmakers portray other members of Spidey's "rogues gallery" in the future. I would have loved to have seen more of Uncle Ben, because, well, Martin Sheen is just awesome. Sally Field gives us an Aunt May that epitomizes the saying "still waters run deep". She is quietly dignified, and also strangely accepting of the, very traumatic, changes happening around her, particularly when she witnesses, first-hand, the very real consequences to Peter following his new status as both a superhero, and designated vigilante.

For me, what made the story of this particular Spider-man so interesting, was not what was put in the film, but what was left out. I won't spoil it for those that haven't seen it (yet) but part of the appeal of this incarnation of our favorite web-slinger, is that the film leaves out some of the very (canonical) elements that we, as an audience, expect to see in a "traditional" Spidey film, and that's what I loved about it. The filmmakers haven't pandered to what we thought we should (and perhaps feel entitled to) see, but have instead given us something that, like this version of Peter Parker himself, is both familiar, and yet completely new at the same time. It subverted my expectations whilst also satisfying those that I already had when I entered the cinema. Because of this experience, I left the film both surprised and elated, with my mind already running through what may, or may not, happen in the next installment. The Amazing Spider-man feels like it is one part of a greater story, and I, for one, eagerly await the next chapter.

There is a lot in The Amazing Spider-man to enjoy, for fans of Raimi's trilogy, to readers of the comics (of which I count myself as one) as well as cinema goers in general. I wont go so far as saying that there's something here for everyone, because that's just wishful thinking. What I will say is this, if you leave your ideas of what a Spider-man film should, or should not, be (or even what has been) at the door, there is a lot to savor, appreciate and even marvel at, in this interpretation of one of our most iconic characters.

title: Spider-man, Spider-man, does whatever a Reboot Can!
review:
The Spiderman Franchise, having crashed and burned with the third movie, which had more villains than a point, is rebooted in this film. So after we've killed poor Uncle Ben again (this time played by Martin Sheen) we get about half a slow moving movie about awkward Peter Parker dealing with awkward teen stuff, and another half of the movie that is over the top, CGI overkill.

The Villain De Jour is the Lizard, an otherwise kindly scientist who is driven mad by his formula in an attempt to regrow a lost arm.

the movie is too disjointed, and it's not like we haven't seen his story a bunch of times before.

I will give them credit for making the web-shooters a device instead of a natural ability that made no sense.

title: The amazing spiderman not so amazing
review:
The amazing Spider-man was not so amazing after all. The story is different yet not so different from the Sam Raimi version and that's why till now I don't understand the point of rebooting it. I read some posh reviews, probably written by pretentious critics who never read a comic in their life and think that all Superhero movies should be dark and gloomy to be good . They all give this movie the thumbs up. This movie is alright, but it is nothing special. I also felt that the creators did not get the essence of Spiderman , the key message "With great power there must also come—great responsibility!" In this version the character did not learn from his mistakes and did not act responsibly.

As for the movie itself I thought the acting was sketchy, the characters undeveloped and the action lacking. The script was weak and all the cool parts were rushed. On the other hand all the unnecessary parts dragged to the extent of getting boring. Unlike Toby Maguire (I know people say I should not compare) Andrew Garfield was monotonous. I did not know if he was happy or sad, excited or scared.

I am not impressed, especially that a reboot should add to the story, not take from it. If I want to watch a spider-man movie I will stick to the Sam Raimi version.

title: what was the use from making such movie
review: OK i went to watch the movie with a hope to enjoy 3d effects (at least) but the first 30 minutes i was bored to death. no good 3d effects, the same boring story (we're all familiar about)and very very slow acting.instead of paying money to make such movie, they'd rather come up with a new fresh story. why remake the spider-man story we've watched many many times (and the old versions were way better).i watched the 2002 version and it was nice, not brilliant and the old version was better and more realistic (no CGI). if u have nothing to do go watch this boring movie and get a nap while watching. same story, done badly with bad acting,no plot....nothing.

title: not so AMAZING though!!!!!!
review:
my first view after watching this movie,,,,, its not so amazing though. ya this movie has good graphics but this cant be said as a good move cos almost all the movies in Hollywood has good graphics,,, so it cant be called amazing by graphics . Next coming to story line,,,, it has the same old story with a change in the super villain ,,,,though the trailers gave a dark theme to the movie it doesn't appear so when it comes to the movie,,,,so it cant be called amazing by storyline.

The next thing is the cast,,,,, first thing comes into mind for peter parker is tobey ,,,,andrew garfield doesn't fit into it,,,,,and the same goes for emma stone too,,,,, not amazing here too.

Almost 3/4th of the world knows who spiderman is and what his story is,,,,, so this movie wont add any spice to the legend

MY WORD: a genuine spiderman movie fan wont find any differnce in this movie

title: Not worth it!
review:
Script, plot: Very same as Spiderman 1. The deviations are disastrous and poorly executed.

The worst thing is predictability... The whole movie is a repetition in itself, if you ever watched Animated series/other Spidey movies. First half is known to everyone! And, "reboot" is a fallacy. Hardly few changes are made, which are welcomed, but they are VERY few...

Action: Very less action!

3D effect: You would hardly feel 3D effects in the movie.

Superheroism: Lacking. sucks big time on this front too. Every time our "ämazing spidey" gets into minutest of trouble, someone comes to save him! No style either.

Don't ruin the memories of previous installments by watching this one.. CRAP!

There is however, one positive side to the movie: the movie can prove to be a real good base for sequels...

title: This a great movie.
review: This reboot is better then the first 3 Spider man movies. This is a great movie. It has great acting. It also has special effects. This one of the best action movie ever. It is better then The Dark Knight. It is a great movie. See it. It is one of the best movie ever. Spider man home coming is better.

title: One of the best movie I have ever seen!!!
review:
Seriously, this movie is groundbreaking, better than what I expected, anyone who says this is bad is lying, because do not accept such a change of mind (from hate to love)

I still love Sam Raimi trilogy (yes...TRILOGY)and I think Spider-Man 1 is the best Spider-Man of them, but compared to TASM, that movie transforms itself in a Green Lantern of life, almost everything in the reboot is better, The Acting, the CGI, the action scenes, Spider-Man 1 only wins in the soundtrack, both are great but the 2002 soundtrack is more captivating and emotional (which I like)

The humor in this movie is just good, not hilarious but good, and that's a big change in the Spider-Man movies, the sarcastic Spider-Man that I always loved is finally here, but it really has to be improved in TASM 2, cause...you know, we all wanna laugh hard.

The Story of this movie...is not untold, I mean the "Untold Story" that is why this reboot exist...doesn't exist, it is cutted off the movie, I really want to see Sony explaining why they may have cutted like 40 minutes of the movie, to make it a bad thing, I have a REALLY HIGH feeling that this movie could have been A LOT better if not so many scenes were cutted...I'm sad, man :(. But that doesn't make the movie bad at all.

Anyway, the theaters should charge more for this movie, like U$30,00, because it is AWESOME, worth price, go watch it

10/10

title: The movie was excellent.
review:
Two things are amazing here...

1. This movie. As a lifelong Spiderman fan, this movie gave me all of the things I loved about the characters.

2. The amount of people who watched this movie and instantly become "professional movie critics" on IMDb, which seem to be the largest group of pathetic lifeless losers on the planet. It astounds me. So many of you bashed this movie, and so many of you praised this movie. And the funny thing is, each of you think you are correct in your opinion.

Get over yourselves. The only thing you are is a viewer. No one cares about your "reviews". ( For those of you about to accuse me of hypocrisy, this isn't a review, I only stated that I enjoyed it).

We're lucky enough to be able to enjoy movies as it is, and yet the only thing you people do is bash bash bash.

Learn to appreciate the things you are provided with. That includes the privilege of having movies be a part of the culture we're a part of.

title: The best superhero film I've ever seen
review:
Yes, you read the title well -- The Amazing Spider-Man was the best of the superhero films I've ever seen including the Dark Knight trilogy and everything else. It's not because of the story or something like that. It has a feeling, a fantastic, heroic atmosphere which is the best I've ever felt. A true Spider-Man film which follows the plots of the comics and has better and more intense scenes like the Raimi version had. I got chills when Spider-Man first time used his web-shooters under the bridge and the final fight is epic and spectacular. . . really, an excellent film.

Anyway the actors were fantastic, far more better than in the 2002 version and the characters had life-like, vivid emotions and reactions. I don't think the new Spider Suit is bad, it looks cool. The Lizard was a perfect antagonist, very well played and written. Marc Webb is a really good director, James Horner is still a genius.

But as I wrote the main reason I like this film so much is the atmosphere, the feeling. It cannot be described by words, you have to be a true Spidey fan to feel it. I just couldn't stop smiling during some scenes.

I cannot wait to the sequel!

title: Great Movie!!
review: It was an excellent movie. At first i thought that remaking the whole movie was not a good idea, but this movies turned out to be really good. If you are a fan of the previous spider-man movies, then you will surely enjoy this one as well. The plot was very good. All the characters were excellent. Andrew Garfield was excellent, he did a great job being Spider-man. Emma Stone was great, looked very pretty as usual in the film. I liked the short cameo by Irfan Khan. I liked how the lizard which was the villain in this film, was a mix of green goblin and Dr. Octavius. Many parts in this film reminded me of the previous parts. If I was to recommend this film, then i would definitely do so. Two thumbs up!!.

title: The Amazing Spiderman Delivers
review:
The Amazing Spider Man tells the story of Peter Parker a young teenager in high school who one day gets bitten by a genetically enhanced spider, he undergoes changes from this.

The Amazing Spider Man is one of those films where I wasn't looking forward to it at first because it was a reboot, and usually with reboots they end up being bad. When I saw the teaser for the film last year, I thought it made Spider Man look like it was going to be dark and gritty, like The Dark Knight was but this was not the case with the actual film. The Amazing Spider Man may be darker then the original Rami films, but it also has plenty of jokes in it to balance it out.

I think why The Amazing Spider Man mainly works for is because the story draws you in, sure its a bit of a generic story but then again so are most other movies of this genre. The film tells the story of Peter Parker and what happens to him when he gets bitten by a genetically enhanced spider and how the changes affect him, it also focuses on the relationships that Peter has with his Aunt and uncle, Gwen Stacy and her father, and Dr. Connors. This is why I think the movie focuses on so many levels, it focuses on the story first and then the action later, its about the relationships in Peter's life its about the changes Peter faces and how they affect his life.

The Amazing Spider Man also delivers on the action and not once during the film does the action get confusing. The only downfall for the movie is that there isn't to many action scenes, while this isn't a bad thing I still would have to liked to see a few more scenes between The Lizard and Spider Man.

All of the actors in the movie delivers solid performances but for me the breakout performance in the movie would have to be Andrew Garfield as Spider Man, if there was one thing the movie had going for it, it would be Garfield. Ever since I saw Garfield in The Social Network I've been a big fan of his, I think Garfield was the perfect choice to portray both Peter Parker and Spiderman because he fits the role so perfectly and delivers a great performance that stands out in the movie, I think Garfield should win an award for his performance. Emma Stone also delivered a strong performance as Gwen Stacy, she made you believe that a girl like her would fall for a nerd like Peter Parker, Emma Stone makes you believe in the relationship that her and Peter has. I would also like to point out that Rhys Ifans delivers a solid performance as Dr. Connors and The Lizard, he makes you feel for the character even though The Lizard is your typical Villain.

The Amazing Spider Man is the best Spider Man film yet, it delivers on everything you would expect from a Spider Man movie and make sure to stay during the end credits as there's a scene mid way through.

title: Andrew Garfield's performance helps TAS to another level
review: First of all I wasn't happy that Sony was going to reboot the series. But an the other hand I was relieved. The movies were great, but something wasn't right about the last spider-movies. And it was the touch that Marc Webb brought into this movie. With Webb you could character development. The characters were better developed than Raimi's characters. Especially Peter Parker and Gwen Stacy. Peter Parker was perfectly played by Andrew. No hate against McGuire. Absolutely not. But Garfield's Parker was funnier, smarter and he wasn't goofy. The level of the movie wasn't better than The Dark Knight, but it wasn't worse than the stupid F4-movies. It was certainly better than the Raimi's trilogy. The movie had a good connection with the comics and the very first love interest: Gwen Stacy. So if you're a spider-fan, go to the movie and for the not die-hard spider fans, go see the movie too.

title: amazing indeed.
review:
When I first heard that Andrew Garfield was going to be the new Spider-Man, I was really interested. I had just watched The Social Network, which he was fantastic in. I didn't enjoy the original Spider-Man trilogy as much as I usually enjoyed Marvel movies, but I had high hopes for this one. Unfortunately, though, after following endless media hype regarding this movie for an entire year, I felt like I was already getting tired of this reboot. By the release date, I wasn't excited at all, just relieved that all the coverage was finally going to start dying down.

I have to admit, my lowered expectations probably influenced my opinion of the movie, because my friends took me to the theater today to watch it, and I was pleasantly surprised. Andrew Garfield (Peter Parker) never fails to disappoint, with all of his effortless nerdy charm. He and Emma Stone (Gwen Stacy) connected well in their scenes together, and you could tell that they were comfortable being with each other. Rhys Ifans (Curt Connors) was fantastic, and yes, his story might seem sort of silly to some, but the way Marc Webb developed his character made his motives believable to me. Denis Leary was great as a father to Gwen and a dedicated policeman. When he first appeared, though, I thought he was Willem Dafoe for a second. Sally Field and Martin Sheen bring a lot of warmth and heart to their characters, and for what little screen time he received, Irrfan Khan was spectacular.

A fun, well-made movie overall. Definitely recommended.

title: Intelligent Design
review:
This was probably one of the best movies I've ever seen.

Here are the main reasons why:

It was very intelligent. I recognized some intriguing concepts from psychology, philosophy, English, social studies, and of course, the obvious science and calculus.

  • Psychology: Phantom Limb - the scene where Dr. Curt Connors looks at the reflection of his arm in the glass.


  • Philosophy: Moral Obligations - "With great power comes great responsibility."


  • English: Archetypes - When the teacher explains that there aren't ten story-lines, but instead just one (identity).


  • Social Studies: Typical Social Issues - Both father figures died, feminism, nationalism, etc.


  • Science and Calculus: Cross Species Genetics, decay rates, the equation, etc.


It had some brilliant juxtapositions (the pairing of two elements that conveys a message either through creating a contradiction or confirmation).

  • When the first lizard scene faded into the sophisticated family dinner. The lizard scales were juxtaposed with the fish's scales. This could probably be analyzed a lot further to convey various important messages.


  • The scene with sexual tension between the two star-crossed lovers deviated the audience from the tension caused by the lizard's rampage. It calmed the audience down to increase the suspense when they jump back into the lizard scene.


The unclear boundaries between good and evil.

  • Peter Parker's initial acts as Spider-Man are to track down bandits that resemble the starry-wristed man who shot his uncle. Also, his indirect connections to his uncle's death and the lizard-gone-wrong experiment.


  • The Lizard's initial good intentions and vulnerability (represented by the human half, Dr. Curt Connors)


  • In general, it shows that powerful, life-changing science can easily be used for evil and is therefore dangerous (potentially the reason why Parker's father disappeared upon discovering his algorithm)


It had a clever way of tying together ideas and events.

  • After his uncle's "responsibility" talk, Peter disobeys him and indirectly becomes responsible for his murder. Smart way of teaching a lesson.


  • Although disturbing, the mutated lab rat devouring the other rat was a clever way to piece together the side-effect of aggressiveness and apply it to the human version of the experiment, Dr. Connors.


Oh, and three more things:

  • The acting and directing was WAY better than the previous Spider-Man movies.


  • The director's last name is Webb. Come on, don't tell me I'm the only one who thinks that this pun is hilariously ironic.


  • Andrew Garfield. Enough said.

title: Spiderman = action
review:
I have been a fan of spider man forever, read the marvel comics, all the animated series and more.

When they decided to do the movie back in 2001, i was very excited. When they casted Toby Macguire has spiderman i was afraid to see the movie and very disappointed. This guy has a face the tells drama, crying and sadness. When they casted Kristen Dunst that put the nail in the coffin for that movie. I just hate her has an actress. I did watch all 3 spiderman movies. The action was good, but too far a part, the whole series turned out to be a big drama, like the walking dead series, a poor excuse to be a drama. Just sad. How did we suffer for Peter Parker running after Mary Jane on all 3 movies, how did we suffer for Mary Jane mistreated by her father and a failed actress. Ha all that agony.

Well i am here to tell you that this crap is all over and i am soooo glad they decided to reboot spiderman, Andrew Garfield is the perfect Peter Parker, he is cocky, he looks a tone better then Maguire, he is funny, this spiderman sort of dropped the drama and got into the action right away. OK they could have spent a bit more time with the morphing into spiderman that was very very quick, they did less character development, but i rather have that then all 3 other spiderman movies, and all that dull drama.

The lizard is amazing, the effects are amazing and i really hope they continue the series with all theses actors, finally we had to wait all that time for a decent spiderman movie. Way to go the reboot is far better then all that drama crying crap we been subjected too in all 3 other spiderman. Three thumbs up

title: Watch and Enjoy
review: Hands Down this was a good movie to just simply watch and enjoy. Not necessary to watch in 3-D... As a movie lover be prepared for a slow start, but as a comic book reader would know it is a "origin story," but nevertheless hang in there for the good stuff, it pays off. Also, Okay... if your too caught up in "Raimi's Smell of Flatulence" by all means watch this movie and do your best to hate it, But Watch it. Compared and Contrasted: Way Better than the Fiasco Known as SPIDERMAN 3, Gotta Wait for part 2 to compare it and so yet Like Spiderman (2002), this movie holds it own!!! Can't wait for the Trinity soon to come. OVERALL: Action level was enough to satisfy, Dramatic impression was enough to tear-jerk me a few times, Comedic essence made me laugh a few times, Romance was enough and not too overwhelming (Love that Emma Stone By the way) and the Suspense was fantastic. So I give this movie a 10 for its enjoyment factor. Go Watch and Enjoy

title: The Mediocre Spiderman
review: Off the bat, the "amazing" spider-man is already a problem for a pedantic brat like myself, but then again the "mediocre" spider-man hasn't really got the same ring to it. obviously most of the plot is the same as the first installment of the previous series which is nobodies fault. i felt that, although i have no real complaints about Andrew Garfield's performance, he did give off much more of a hipster vibe than the nerdy loser portrayed by Toby Maguire. this might have been a conscious decision made by the management to try and "nudge" the envelope. also when in one of the underwhelming pillow fights between lizard man and spider dude i found the quips infuriatingly annoying. so all in all i would not recommend this film

title: Marc Webb takes us back to The Amazing Spider-Man's basics.
review:
Actually I loved it! I think that Marc Webb, the film director, did an excellent job by getting us closer to Peter Parker, He perfectly captured the adolescent presented in the comics. He did great by taking us to the basic principles of Spider-Man presented in the comics, a young man with human conflicts like anyone.

Definitely not a pure action film, Marc Webb takes time to develop the characters and I think it succeeds very well. Although for children may seem a little slow.

Andrew Garfield and Emma Stone definitely an asset to the film, I liked more the aunt & uncle cast in this movie than in the last trilogy. The whole cast in general is great.

The only thing that didn't convinced me was the Lizard face, it looks more human than lizard, but I prefer this design thousand times to the Green Goblin's costume in Spider-Man 1 which had nothing to do with any outfit presented in the comics.

I don' t know if Marc Webb plans to show Gwen Stacy- Green Goblin's storyline in the next films, would be very interesting to see the response of the general audience who aren't familiarized to that comic storyline.

I found the 3D IMAX brutal and 100% recommended.

In short, I think a superhero movie very well made, different rhythm to the Avengers, but more than justified and definitely the best of Spider-Man.

title: A remake or is it just the same dish?
review:
Well to start off yes there are good things about this movie; like Emma Stone and maybe some of the effects but really there's a whole lot more bad than good.

For one thing this is the same story, yes all the actors have changed and the the main bad guy is not the green goblin and the main love interest isn't Mary Jane but the whole thing is so similar if you substituted some of the new characters with the old ones it'd would be almost exactly the same. I kept thinking this happened in the first movie the whole movie. Now people might say that the movies are bound to the comics so it's bound to be similar but from what I saw almost no creative license was used.

The second point is I hate it when things are just too coincidental, things in the movie are just too lucky. Like the kid he saves on the bridge just happens to be the kid of a guy who's a big shot at a construction firm, there are buildings being built all the way up the street to Ozcorp, Gwens father just happens to be the police chief type guy, or just when spiderman is about to lose his head at the end gwens father comes and saves the day, the list could go on and on.

I didn't really like the first 3 movies but they weren't all that bad, instead of starting the whole process all over again I think they should have spent time on making a nice script and making a forth movie with the already established people. I think the first 3 movies were move emotional and got you more attached to the characters, I for one didn't care at ALL when gwens dad died.

title: AMAZING to say the least.
review:
OK. First, I don't know what's all with the hate with this movie and its director.

I personally loved it. I think it was the best Spiderman film ever.

I loved the cinematography on this, I personally think it is more convincing than The Avengers, it's actually in par with Iron Man in terms of cinematography.

Acting, it was great, Andrew Garfield and Emma Stone did an awesome job and Rhys Ifans as-well.

I think Spiderman is going at the right track.

To all the haters out there. Don't just judge the movie because you were in love with the first 3 films. I love the first trilogy, but this one..this one "takes the cake" so to speak.

WATCH IT!

title: A Fresh New Feel for a Superhero Movie
review:
I hesitate in giving this movie a "10" for not being taken seriously, but it was a great film and excellent in my mind. Why so many bad reviews then? I think the expectations might have been different for many viewers.

This film was a fresh grounding to reality for a superhero movie. I've always wondered why the directors make superhero films feel "different" ... almost "cartoony" at times? Some might expect a 2 hour long epic battle with a spider-man character that is the most powerful ever - able to anything and everything. Instead, we see a young man, a high school teenager, struggling with all the elements of that age as well as some deep rooted personal family history. He becomes something more, given the abilities of Spiderman. The transformation is somewhat messy, and we get to see the learning curve. Integral to the transformation is his personal life, which is interwoven perfectly with his transformation into Spiderman. Peter maintains his humanity both physically and emotionally.

Andrew Garfield and Emma Stone have great chemistry on screen. Denis Leary is believable and does not overplay the role. Martin Sheen and Sally Field play Peter's aunt and uncle as well as anyone could. Martin Sheen especially.

The film doesn't feel forced like many superhero movies. It feels real as if it could actually happen, it might go down something like this. I understand many viewers consider it too slow and boring, but that may be a representation on our have-it-now society. It is not rushed, and time is taken to depict the characters in enough detail to engage the audience. Peter's reaction to his new powers as well as the saga that unfolds is both exciting and emotionally engaging. The story is similar to the first film in some key elements, but those really cannot be changed without significantly deviating from the comic. The balance of real people and super-hero action is perfect. It's not like The Avengers, but instead more of a Batman Begins. There is a lot of time spent on character development and I felt engaged and emotionally connected to the characters and the story as much as any other well written non-superhero drama.

I hope the public supports this type of superhero movie. I'm getting tired of garbage like the second two films in The Transformers saga. The Amazing Spiderman gives a very human and very real feel to the Spiderman franchise. Go into it expecting a great movie, not a soon-to-be-forgotten popcorn summer blockbuster. I don't think this reboot could have been done any better. This was exactly what I had hoped for and the creators delivered phenomenally.

title: Not so amazing Spider-Man...
review:
I just came out of the movie theatre tonight. I feel very disappointed about the reboot of the Spider-Man movies. I don't understand why they did it if they can't do better than the Sam Raimi's movies.

Andrew Garfield's acting was just horrible. I always felt he wasn't really there, I felt his was out of touch with the character he was incarnating. Sometimes he had no emotions on his face, or he was overacting or simply had the wrong reaction to the events. It felt like he just didn't know what to do so he did anything he liked on the spot. It completely destroyed everything for me. He never looked like a convincing nerd, or never looked like a convincing boy who is supposed to be torn apart between loving a girl and fighting justice. He had too much attitude and not enough character defining acting. They never should have choose him.

Then the story of this movie was not so good. It felt like the director cut corners at some point to go straight to the point, which at the end made the story unreal and a bit boring. After all, we are looking at the exact same story we looked only 10 years ago but with a couple of not so interesting differences here and there. I just don't get the point to start again the same story if it is not as good or better as the first trilogy. At least we have a new bad guy, but why didn't they just continued the trilogy with this bad guy? The action isn't so good. The bad guy is very good looking except the fact he look to much CG for me. There are nice shots here and there in the movie, but a lot of scenes are very difficult to swallow because of the reaction of the characters or the way the story evolves. The hold up scene was awful...

I felt like I lost my time watching a bad copy of 2002's Spider-Man.

title: it was a confused spider man instead
review: "chamatkari makda manav" A.K.A "The amazing spider man" was not at all amazing typical bollywood movie.... "3D" 90% movie seemed to be in 2D Emma stone- Gwen Stacy didn't worked out well ("adult citizen") ;P n the LIZARD looked like a cartoon character.... (SIDE ROLL) IRFAN KHAN- a thankless roll, did a hard work but the roll had no contribution in the movie.... script was poor most of the interesting part were not even discovered( incomplete work) it was a confused spider man the plus points.... Andrew Garfield- peter Parker acted well n direction was good overall the worst movie in the spider man series its just a one watch movie

title: A Useless Remake. Come on there was no need for this!
review:
It is now almost ten years since the couple Raimi - Maguire , brought to the big screen the fifth Marvel film, Spiderman , receiving critical acclaim and box office and a worldwide success. With this remake (now they say "reboot" because it's cooler) , they tried to repeat these successes without succeed and now I'll explain why.

Let's begin to talk about the cast, in SM there were Maguire, Franco, Dunst, Simmons, Banks, and Dafoe, where rare case they chose to hire a protagonist who is not the usual handsome jock, but a normal average looking guy - capable of great interpretation, Maguire is not only a good actor, but for the role of Peter he has trained physically for over six months, this means commitment . As for the antagonist, Dafoe is certainly much better than Ifans, even though Goblin does not become as muscled as Lizard that looks like a scaled Hulk complete with a retinue and claws. In general it seems that in The Amazing Sm, they have assembled a cast that would attract people to the box office, in fact Garfield and Stone are actors who are particularly popular and fashionable lately, as well as the director that it certainly does not have many arrows in his bow.

As for the plot , there have been small distortions that currently seem unnecessary, like the story of the death of the parents of Peter, the lack of Bugle and Mary Jane, things that we could have also be in it if the changes would have brought narrative improvements, which unfortunately are absent. It seems that they simply wanted to overdo it by copying the idea from the new Batman of DC, where, however, Garfield is not worth a fingernail of Bale and Webb does not even deserve to replace the toilet paper of Mr.Nolan. The strange thing is that Marvel had already managed to greatly improve a character with a remake, I'm referring to Hulk and The Incredible Hulk, there it made sense to reinvent a character from scratch to make a better film than the previous with different spans, as opposed to comparing to this new Sm, where the only improvement is the technical one, and not even that much, personally I expected a lot more action scenes and fights (after all, if a person would want a dull movie you would rent the dull ' "The horse Whisperer", no?) .

The only significant innovations are the fabulous cameo by Stan Lee and the secret ending after the credits .

I would like to say one thing to the producers, writers , director and actors in this little Amazing Spiderman: with great power comes great responsibility, you could have made a great Film, I even went to the cinema to watch this piece of crap, and you have barely been able to reach the same level of the old film. Just awful!

title: What an amazingly poor reboot!
review:
Even if you take this film as a film in it's own right it would still be a terrible film but then you can't take it as a film in it's own right as it's a reboot so you have to compare it to what has gone before. OK so lets do that. Compared to what has gone before this film is boring, tedious, long drawn out, far too long, extremely messy,

There is only one good scene in the whole film and it is a very short one in the school where Spiderman and The Lizard are fighting in the school and enter a classroom with a teacher in who is listening to music absolutely oblivious to the fact the two of them are fighting behind him. That is the ONLY good scene in the film and it lasts for about thirty seconds to about one minute! The one line of sarcastic wit is also said in the fight in the school

As much as I hate to say it because it's nice to finally see Hollywood casting an English actor (well, I say English because although born in America he was brought up in England) in a lead role that isn't the villain Andrew Garfield did not fit the role at all! But then he, like any actor, can only do the best that they can with the script that they are given and the script in this film was awful, and so was the directing which also doesn't make an actor look good on, screen none of it helped make him the right man for the job! Emma Stone dyed her hair for this role. What she should have done was dyed it for another role if she wanted to dye it so badly at all! Again, her part, like all of them was lifeless and therefore tedious to watch and in this version the character of Gwen Stacy got to know Peter Parker and Spiderman are one and the same person even though that NEVER happened in the comics as the only girlfriend so far that got to know who was under the mask was Mary- Jane Watson. Gwen's father and a child in a car also got to know who was under the mask and that should not have happened!

oh and I keep getting the feeling that I'm watching a parallel universe with the Marvel universe films as the Toby Maguire films were pretty much true to the comic books but this film? Almost nothing like them!

THIS IS TO BE CONTINUED!

title: A Horrible Remake of Spiderman (2002)
review:
Let's break it down:

● The new *amazing* Spiderman has suddenly lost his healing powers: During the entire film Spiderman gets scratched and injured, and the wounds just stay. In one scene Gwen even gives Spiderman a medical assistance for just a few scratches. What's next? A hospitalization for a broken foot or a stomach upset?

● No Mary Jane, no Daily Planet: In an outward appearance, this movie is a crude remake of Spiderman (2002) film and it copies everything but the important parts: Jonah Jameson from the Daily Planet and the romantic tension between Peter Parker and Mary Jane. Why are you trying to retell a story which is already perfectly told?

● Unclosed corners:

Why did Peter Parker's parents die? What was the briefcase that they left him and why?

Why does Peter Parker stops to search for his uncle Ben's murderer for absolutely no reason, and continues with his life as usual?

What is the idea behind Lizard's attempt to infect the city if the impact is temporary anyway? Even by injection Dr. Curt Connors stays as The Lizard for less than a day.

Why is there no press in the movie? A new superhero comes and no press opinion?

Why does Spiderman keeps revealing the man behind the mask so damn often?

Why is Aunt May like a ghost in this film? Does she really can't have more impact than cooking dinners?

★ You cannot reboot an already perfectly done franchise! ★

Bad. Awful. Horrible.

title: Now people, it's getting ridiculous!
review:
Imagine you buy a 100 pages super hero comic book and all you read is some 'amazing' private facts about the life of Peter Parker, the guy who's going to become the amazing Spiderman. You will be really pi**ed off! The good thing with the comic book, you can stop reading and throw it in a corner where your dog can grab it later. The bad thing with the movie, you have to sit through it.

The problem seems to be: What to do with a $230,000,000 budget? Make just an action movie? Ohhh no, that is not enough, you have to reach the broadest target audience as possible. So your are starting to construct a plot that has everything in it: romance, love, desires, fears ... some action, but not too much, to reconcile every ingredient which makes your movie an attraction for all the boys and girls, families, whoever. How to construct an emotionally deep plot that every twilight fan-girl loves around a nerd who get's bitten by a radioactive spider and then transform into something spider-like himself and who likes to wear mesh stockings and a mask since then? You have NO chance, it MUST be full of clichés, otherwise your audience would not understand what the hell you are going to tell them. And for a $230,000,000 budget, you do not dare to copy just some lines from The Love Boat or so, Shakespeare's romeo and Juliet might be a more appropriate template.

The result is this ridiculous mess of a movie. If Hollywood goes on with those super super hero movies, the actors will make them self redundant. Computer animated figures are totally sufficient for portraying such one dimensional and stupid industry mainstream characters. And that could look far better than the pushover in a latex costume we have here.

title: Terrible character development - uneven, missing, etc.
review: There were so many times in this movie where characters and their relationships (as well as their reactions / behavior) appeared in scenes that appeared to be plopped in -- without the necessary preceding scenes for character/relationship development that would make it logical. Very weird - I felt as if I had walked out of the movie a number of times and missed important detail. Spiderman's relationship with the girl (in all stages), his reactions and acclimation to his new abilities, the school outcast -- just left me wondering how the screenplay got through.
